1.text: Better is a dry morsel and quietness therewith, than an house full of feasting with strife.

2.text: A servant that dealeth wisely shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part in the inheritance among the brethren.

3.text: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.

4.text: An evil-doer giveth heed to wicked lips; and a liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue.

5.text: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.

6.text: Childrenâ€™s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

7.text: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.

8.text: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.

9.text: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love: but he that harpeth on a matter separateth chief friends.

10.text: A rebuke entereth deeper into one that hath understanding than an hundred stripes into a fool.

11.text: An evil man seeketh only rebellion; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

12.text: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

13.text: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

14.text: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before there be quarrelling.

15.text: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, both of them alike are an abomination to the LORD.

16.text: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, seeing he hath no understanding?

17.text: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

18.text: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his neighbour.

19.text: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: he that raiseth high his gate seeketh destruction.

20.text: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.

21.text: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

22.text: A merry heart is a good medicine: but a broken spirit drieth up the bones.

23.text: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom, to pervert the ways of judgment.

24.text: Wisdom is before the face of him that hath understanding: but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

25.text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.

26.text: Also to punish the righteous is not good, nor to smite the noble for their uprightness.

27.text: He that spareth his words hath knowledge: and he that is of a cool spirit is a man of understanding.

28.text: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: when he shutteth his lips, he is esteemed as prudent.
